availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Griffin Kelly (Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster.)

body.p: Henry County, Kentucky, farmer and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Rebecca Jane Smith Kelly in Oldham County, Kentucky, on September 25, 1834. Father of Elizabeth Kelly, Isaac Kelly, Joseph Kelly, Hellen Kelly, and Clinton Kelly. Farmer in Henry County in 1850. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in Henry County in 1850. Postmaster for Midview in Henry County from March 12, 1857 to January 29, 1858. Farmer in Henry County in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons Henry County in 1860. in Postmaster for Midview in Henry County from August 21, 1860 to September 29, 1863.
